description: Students examine expository texts such as (auto)biographical writings, journalistic articles, and
critical essays, with an eye to understanding the strategic organization of the text, the
information presented, and the various layers of critical voices in a text.  Coursework includes
weekly writing assignments on the analysis of structure, style, argumentation, evidence, and
perspective in a text.  The course is designed to teach students writing strategies and the final
project is a short paper written in German.  Taught in German. May be counted toward German
major or German studies concentration. Prerequisite: German 232 or equivalent.
